page.title: 01AREA DESCRIPTION
page.content: This block is on the western edge of Hull.It is equally divided between housing and farming.The southern half of the block is mainly residential centred on two villages (Willerby and Kirkella, total pop. 5000).Willerby in particular seems to be a suburb of Hull.The housing is a mixture of traditional terraced and semi-detached with several recent developments of small private estates. Kirkella retains more of the character of a rural village with its centre around the medieval church of St. Andrew's.The houses are generally bigger and more expensive than in Willerby, a large percentage being semis or detached. The only industry is a small, light industrial estate on Great Gutter Lane, Willerby.
